CatDescriptText: James Cooper, postal clerk, Reading and Viola Jones, beautician, Webster Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" James Cooper's answer reads: "Not enough recreational activities."  Viola Jones' answer reads: "I think the parents, because they don't have time enough to spend disciplining their children.  They are too busy trying to get a hold of other things."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Cooper wearing polo shirt and hat, standing in front of window; Portrait of Viola Jones wearing flower and eyeglasses, standing in front of Sherwin Williams and C.C. Mellors, Smithfield Street, Downtown
